content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Sure, here is a simple solution using Julia DataFrames package:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = Dates.format.(df[:dt], "yyyyMM") |> map(x -> parse(Int, x))
end
```
This function takes a dataframe `df` as input and adds a new column `:ym` to it. The content of the new column is created by formatting each DateTime in `dt` with `"yyyyMM"` format and parsing each resulting string into an integer.
